page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: A GENERAL VIEW OF FARMING Basically marginal land, but the North of the area,where the altitude decreases the farming becomes more intensive, consisting of self supporting dairy farms.To the south of the area the farms are smaller and tend to be beef-sheep units and do not grow any cereals.On the smaller units the farming is part time, with the husband in full time employment in Shrewsbury. Larger units to the north of the area have average herd sizes of 80-90 British Fresian cows, being self sufficient for winter feed.The milk is collected and transported to Minsterley creamery and made into dairy products. The average field size in the north of the area is 15 acres and in the south 4 acres
